IDK about the SLS tool. It picks up human figures because the chairs are vaguely shaped like people. If you notice, the legs line up exactly with the legs of the chair and at the same point where the chair legs contact the ground. The same thing for the arms...they line up with the backrest posts. The empty chair was empty because when the chair is angled, it no longer vaguely looks human, so the tool doesn't recognize it.

I've been here before with family members!! They actually do ghost tours some times around the city of Alton! It's really sad and spooky learning some of the history!
So, i went here with my family in fall of 2022, and we had some insane encounters. the first one was when my mom, my brother and I went to the basement after the tour, and my brother was going to pick up a pair of dice, then my mom randomly screamed at him not to (very not like her) and went on to explain that she felt/heard something or someone saying not to pick the dice up. then, the tour guide did the estes method in the pool, my brothers chair was pulled back (down the slope of the pool) right after a cold breeze came though. after that, i was heading down stairs to get my brother because my mom needed him, and he was alone down there, i called out down the stairs 3 times before I began to go down to get him, before i could even take my second step, i heard a screaming voice say "NO! OUT!" as if it was in my head. and i felt 2 hands push me up the stairs. i ran back to my mom and felt sick for the rest of the night. all that, on top of my mom reading a book to a small child spirit in the attic. some other people that were there had a spirit box, which we spoke to the child ghost with, my mom is a teacher, so that's why we believe the child was more attracted to her. when she would finish reading the book, the spirit box would say "again". and it was crazy, my mom started crying at some point because she is very energy prone.  we also had alot of other encounters including some answers to yes or no questions using an EMF reader.   sorry if this was hard to understand, i just really wanted to share my story as this was my first and only haunted place ive been to myself. very cool to see Sam and Colby going there too

Long time watcher I mean since Vine!!! LMAO!! If you're looking for an amazing place with a pool and that some amazing paranormal activity, that would be Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The Eagles Club (The Rave as it is known by the city folk) known for it history of originally being a mafia hang-out spot and some real shady stuff. The place is definitely haunted!! It is now a concert and banquet hall, and I've been there many times for concerts and have experienced some very interesting and unexplainable things. And if that wasn't enough, the cherry on the cake is the Ambassador Hotel. The same kind of stories also connect to the hotel the is adjacent to the venue. The mafia had a huge presence in Milwaukee for a long time in the early 1900s. If this interests you or catches you or Colby's eyes, please reach out, I'd love to tag along and get to experience the best of the paranormal areas of my hometown (and get to chill with the most amazing paranormal creators on YouTube).

There are MANY things that contribute to the hauntings of Alton, but I believe thereâ€™s one particular thing that has brought those hauntings into the homes of our people. During the civil war there was a confederate prison in downtown alton made out of limestone from the bluffs. All of the prisoners contracted small pox and all of the people that didnâ€™t die in the prison (guards and prisoners) were taken to an island on the Mississippi River and left there to die. There were 1,300 soldiers that died in the prison and 3-5,000 people that died on the island which was then named Small Pox Island. The prison was eventually torn down and the bricks were used to build houses and business in the Alton area. So not only do we have the limestone bluffs and the water element for the spiritual realm, we also have homes built out of bricks that are haunted by thousands of dead confederate soldiers. Many houses in the downtown alton area have underground tunnels below the homes, used in the Underground Railroad. We have McPike Mansion which is believed to have roughly 12 different spirits inside the home. Many haunted schools including Milton School. Overall just lots of spooky scary vibes!

While you guys were in Alton, IL.... you should have checked out the McPike Mansion. It has LOTS of haunted history also.   Ive visited it and it was an interesting location
"A long time ago, one day, one of the families living on Goed ter Walle, the smallest child became ill. It suddenly started crying loudly and kept crying. The farmer and his wife no longer knew what to do and, on the advice of the pastor, they sought help from the Norbertine fathers in Drongen. They quickly realized the seriousness of the matter and immediately sent two monks to Poesele. Praying loudly, they walked through the farm house from the cellars to the attic and sprinkled all the rooms with palm branches soaked in holy water. When this was unsuccessful, they started praying again while examining the house from head to toe. In the basement they stopped in front of a linen cupboard and in one of the top drawers they found an unknown rag doll with three pins inside. When they took it out of the doll in prayer, the child stopped crying and gradually recovered."  an old story from belgium

The Ghost House of Rondebosch  Jac Loopuyt House, also known as The Ghost House of Rondebosch, is a picturesque Edwardian residence nicknamed â€œThe Spook Houseâ€. It is rumoured that a strange cult resided there in the 1970â€™s and there are stories of doors being opened and closed inexplicably and a transparent elderly man wandering around.
The Ghost of Verlatenbosch is an enduring tale set on Table Mountain. It is said that a governor of Cape Town made an enemy of a citizen. The citizen came up with a dark plan: he gave the governorâ€™s son a beautiful flute as a gift. Unbeknownst to the governor or his son, the flute was once owned by a leper. Within days of the son playing his flute, he became ill. He was forced into exile in a lonely hut at on the mountain, where he played his flute until he died. Some say on a still evening in the forest, you can still hear his mournful tune today.

IVE SPENT DAYS finding storyâ€™s an information about this place for you guys please please just give me a reply
The Virginia House was built in 1873 and fully renovated in 1987 and is on the list of Virginiaâ€™s Historic Places. While there are no sleeping rooms in The Virginia House, there are ample meeting spaces for groups of all sizes.  History  The medicinal waters and the curative powers of the numerous springs in and around Orkney Springs have brought travelers to this quaint Virginia village at the foot of the Great North Mountain since the early nineteeth century. In the 1850â€™s the Orkney Springs Hotel began its construction and the main facility, The Virginia House was completed in 1873. With its white clapboard structure and tall, green-shuttered windows, The Virginia House is four stories high. The 96,000 square-foot building includes a 5,000 square foot Ball Room, a forty foot by one hundred fifty foot dining hall and numerous small meeting and break out rooms.   In 1979 Shrine Mont purchased the Orkney Springs Hotel and the surrounding 1,000 acres of land and restored the facility in 1987. At that time the common areas, meeting rooms and dining facilities were renovated.  Today more than 15,000 people pass through the Shrine Mont Conference Center each year.  The First Floor  The first floor contains the lobby and front desk, the gift shop & bookstore and administrative offices.  Download a floor plan of The Virginia House first floor.  The Second Floor  The Ladies Parlor is located on the second floor. This space is 40 feet by 50 feet and can comfortably seat 100 people as a meeting space or for a reception. There are six additional rooms for small group meetings. Each can seat ten people comfortably.  The second floor also contains a dining hall that can seat up to 300 people. Nice video as always! You guys should visit  The Fortress Hohensalzburg in Austria, Salzburg. I never rlly visited there but i've heard many things about it! (Btw, Austria is in Europe and its a country beside Germany. The language is German.)   Small imformation: There are not too many spots in Salzburg, from where the 11th-century-fortress cannot be seen. For a long time, it was the residence of Salzburg's archbishops and as you can imagine the scene of many historical events. Many a prisoner had to languish in its dungeons. The most well-known of them probably being Archbishop Wolf Dietrich von Raitenau, who had fallen from grace and had to face the end of his life in imprisonment. Hohensalzburg is known as one of the largest castles in Europe and as this building has had a great deal of influence on the city and its surroundings, so it also has become the scenery of many of Salzburg's legends. Who haunts the place? No castle would be complete without her: The White Lady. The one in Salzburg's fortress is described as a beautiful woman, who walks the courtyards and halls of the castle at nights, dressed in a flowing white robe. Time and time again she appeared â€“ preferably in full-moon-nights â€“ for announcing tragic and disastrous events. Even the brave night watches of the castle met her with a lot of respect. If you want to spot her nowadays, you have to be more attentive. Since they started the electric illumination of the Fortress Hohensalzburg at night, sightings of the White Lady have unfortunately decreased. But when the fortress is shrouded in mist in many a chilly night in November, she might sometimes show herself very briefly.  Ideas:  The fortress can comfortably be reached by funicular. If you prefer to walk, you will near the fortress after a short and steep walk uphill, while being rewarded with great views of the old town area. There are a few different museums and exhibitions inside the fortress, so make sure to also have enough time for your visit.

i recommend the castle Houska in czechia, that practically mean the 'Bun Castle', it's said that there's a portal, "gateway to hell", in the middle.   "Houska Castle, and most specifically the chapel, was constructed over a large hole in the ground that is a "gateway to Hell", which is allegedly so deep that no one could see the bottom of it. Animal-human hybrids were reported to have crawled out of it, and dark-winged, otherworldly creatures flew in its vicinity. Legend has it that when construction began in the castle, all of the prisoners that were sentenced to death were offered a pardon if they consented to be lowered by rope into the hole, and report back on what they saw. When the first person was lowered, he began screaming after a few seconds, and when pulled back to the surface, he looked as if he had aged 30 years. He had grown wrinkles and his hair had turned white." (from wikipedia)

You guys should go to The Yesteryear Village. It's located in West Palm Beach Florida. It seems like a Nuclear test village from the 1950's. It has been used as a dorm for a near by college as well as other things like the home of a woodland cemetery gate keeper. There have been reports of people seeing things walking by windows, being pushed, spoken(whispered) to, and witnessing lights go on and off when they were the only ones there. It is rumored to have angry spirits. Joseph, the said to be house owner at the time, was facing many struggles financially and decided to hang himself in the attic. After his suicide a diary he wrote on strange things he witnessed in the house was reported. After this many more strange occurrences happened. Barry Cochrane (ghost hunter) has also gone through this house, honestly I do not totally believe it is true coming from him. It is said that there is an even bigger underlying secret in this house. Just an idea for a future video! more information can be found online or more scary places in Florida that I think you should visit at this link: https://www.inflorida.com/news/south-floridas-most-haunted-places/795  (Colony Hotel & Cabana Club  and Jonathan Dickinson State Park)

You guys should go to the Mount Washington Hotel in Bretton Woods NH.  Joseph died shortly after the hotel was built, and his wife Carolyn then remarried to a French Prince. Although she had remarried, Princess Carolyn continued to spend summers at the hotel. It is believed that Carolyn now haunts the hotel that her first husband built. Specifically, multiple sightings and spooky occurrences have been recorded in her old suite, now guest room #314. I'd say you blew the match ritual.   It MUST light the first time you strike it, if the ritual is going to work at all in the first place, which I doubt.   Next time, try this: 3 three inch diameter candles (White - NEVER Black).    Place one 3 feet from the entrance (centered) - place the other two 3 feet back at an angle 3 feet apart, forming a triangle. It seems like at the beginning, the husband was just speaking through Colby and the wife was attempting to speak through Valkyrae but wasn't communicating very clearly, combined with the fact Valkyrae hasn't ever done the Estes method before so needed a bit to get used to it whereas Colby is very used to discerning words through the noise. I've done the Estes method before and it took me a while to find the groove, and once you do it takes an almost meditative amount of concentration. Then they seemingly swapped because Colby could hear her more clearly, and I think the husband's loud and domineering presence was much easier for Valkyrae to hear and discern among the noise. But then they seemingly both went to Colby, and then it was almost like the husband took over both of their radios, with the wife fighting to get a word in whenever she could.

Here's some more history about Alton you might not be aware of, something many from Alton and the surrounding areas believe contribute to the paranormal activity within the townâ€¦Alton was the site of the first penitentiary for the state of Illinois. This penitentiary was later used during and after the Civil War by the Union army to house Confederate prisoners of war. Supposedly during this time many Southern soldiers endured poor treatment and starvationâ€¦when the union was through and the state closed down the penitentiary, the state didn't want to waste the prison and since Alton was growing quite rapidly at the time, many of the blocks from the penitentiary were repurposed into corner stones of new buildingsâ€¦which some say, allowed for the spread of supernatural spirits all throughout the city!

At the hotel there is a bride that died at the hotel. she is usually spotted on the hotels marble staircase that she supposedly was going down or up to the wedding she was supposed to get married at and died at by her dress getting caught on or set on fire there is no way of knowing. There is also Bellman named Sam McCauley who died later on from supposedly natural causes but came back to haunt the hotel. Is it just me or Colby likes Rae
Not saying this is true or anything but, the whole party ritual was very interesting to me in the fact that it seemingly wasn't done correctly which, as Sam stated, could invite negative entities. Later we know that Pearl's husband, a seemingly negative entity was at the party as he claims he was behind the group the entire time during the Estes method. During the party whilst in the pool the name "Michael" comes up and seems displeased but not outright aggressive. In Christian Theology, the name Michael is tied to the Archangel who is said to be the vanquisher of evil spirits. Perhaps the opening of the ritual being done improperly thus opening it up to negative entities sparked Michael's attention which may be as to why there wasn't a lot of activity picked up in an area otherwise rampant with it. As far fetched as this may sound, the tour guide did say that his experience may have been the work of an Angel attempting to relocate him away from the negative entities, so it may be possible that the location is guarded and watched over by Angels, since the Well could possibly be a portal of sorts, which is why Michael operated so swiftly. Again, not saying this is true but, I see it as a possibility.

anyways, heres a brownie recipe  ingredients * 		2 Eggs * 		1/4 cup Sugar * 		1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract * 		1/2 cup Butter or margarine, unsalted, melted * 		1 1/4 cups Ghirardelli Sweet Ground Chocolate and Cocoa * 		2/3 cup All-purpose flour * 		1/4 teaspoon Baking powder * 		1/4 teaspoon Salt * 		15 Ghirardelli Milk Chocolate Caramel SQUARES   directions * 		Preheat oven to 350Â°F. * 		Stir eggs with sugar and vanilla. * 		Add melted butter. * 		Sift ground chocolate with flour, baking powder, and salt. * 		Stir into egg mixture. * 		Spread half the batter into a greased 8-inch square pan. * 		Place Milk Chocolate Caramel SQUARES in a single layer on top of batter. * 		Cover the SQUARES layer with the remaining batter. * 		Bake 20 to 30 minutes. * 		Cut into 16 to 20 squares

Anyway here's a brownie recipe. Ingredients: - 1 cup of unsalted butter - 2 cups of granulated sugar - 4 large eggs - 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract - 1/2 cup of all purpose flour - 1/2 cup cocoa powder - 1/4 teaspoon of salt - 1 cup of chopped nuts or chocolate chips  1. Preheat oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease a baking pan 2. Melt 1 cup of butter and mix with 2 cups of sugar 3. Add 4 eggs and one teaspoon of vanilla; mix well 4. Sift in 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 cup cocoa, 1/4 teaspoon salt; stir 5. Optional: add 1 cup of nuts of chocolate chips 6. Pour into the pan and bake for 25 - 30 mins 7. Cool completely, cut into squares and enjoy your brownies  (As per request of @caleblawrence3240 , make sure to make them with love)

Ya you guys did the hosting game wrong . These r the instructions. 1. Begin at night. Keep your timekeeping apparatus and the matches on your person at all times. 2. Turn of all possible sources of noise in your dwelling. This includes telephones, televisions, computers, alarms, etc.. Be thorough. If your hosting room requires it, then draw the curtains or block the windows so that no light could be viewed from within the room. 3. Enter your hosting space and turn on the light. If the room includes no lamps or overhead lighting, use a flashlight, lantern, lit candle, or other portable light source. Candles, although correct concerning atmosphere, may pose a fire hazard, so proceed with caution. 4. Place your writing implement and piece of paper on your hosting room. 5. Leaving the light source, depart your hosting space. Proceed to the furthest point in your house from the area and call, â€œIâ€™ll be ready soon!â€ Move from room to room of your house, repeating this phrase in each room, moving closer to your hosting space with every call. 6. When you arrive back in your hosting room, use the writing implement to write the next message on the piece of paper: â€œYouâ€™re invited! A gathering, hosted by [Your Name]. Takes place from [the present time] to [an hour from the current time]. Bring friends and family!â€ 7. Put the piece of paper in the center of the hosting room. 8. Stand in the door of the hosting room facing into the room and telephone, â€œIâ€™m ready! Come in!â€ The Gathering: 1. Switch off the light and turn around. The open door to the hosting space should be at your back: you ought to be facing the shadow of your dwelling. Take out your three matches. 2. After a few moments of silence, begin counting out loud, starting at one and ending at 10. Do not look back. 3. When you get to the count of 10, strike the first match.If the first game lights on the first attack: Hold it as it burns and greet your guests by saying, â€œIâ€™m so glad to see you! Thank you for coming!â€ Hold the match until it burns down as low as you can bear. If the match doesnâ€™t light on the first strike: Drop it and immediately proceed to the next step. 4. Do not look back. Strike the second match. If the next game lights on the first strike:Hold it as it burns and greet more of your guests by saying, â€œI am so glad to see you! Thank you for coming!â€ Hold the game until it burns down as low as you can bear.If the second match does not light on the first strike:Drop it and immediately proceed to the next step. Do not look back. Strike the third match. 5. Do not look back. Strike the third match. If the third game lights on the first strike: Say, â€œNow everyone is here!â€ and count from one to 10 once more. If you have done this correctly, youâ€™ll be able to hear and/or feel whispering, rustling, or a silent â€œthank youâ€ behind you. Do not look back. When your timekeeping device indicates the gatheringâ€™s finishing time, say out loud, â€œThank you for coming. Goodbye.â€ Walk to the nearest light source and turn it on. The gathering is finished and your guests have gone. If the third match doesnâ€™t light on the first strike: Youâ€™ve got uninvited guests. Do NOT look back. Do NOT turn around. I heard of some haunted placed in ohio (this is some short stuff i got from an article about them)  Moonville Tunnel in McArthur   This abandoned stretch of railway leading to an old coal mining town attracts paranormal enthusiasts hoping for a glimpse the unfortunate souls killed by trains over the years. You might also see train lights or find images of Frank Lawhead* on your camera. Those hoping for these ghostly encounters can trek nearby trails, some of which are along portions of the old railroad line.   *According to legend, in 1880 train engineer Frank Lawhead was operating a train when another incoming train caused a head-on collision.  South Bass Island Lighthouse in Put-in-Bay     A favorite Ohio vacation spot has its fair share of eeriness and mystery. Reports of creepy footsteps, slamming doors and unexplained noises coming from the lighthouse may have come from a century-old mystery. During the smallpox epidemic, the story of Samuel Anderson's death was ruled a suicide after falling, jumping â€“ or being pushed â€“ off a cliff by the lighthouse. While the lighthouse is currently closed, you can walk the grounds.

John Wayne Gacey dressed as a clown and entertained kids at birthday parties. He did not kill or lure small children.  Nor did he kill while dressed as a clown.  He did, however, lure teenage boys to his house with the promise of construction work with under the table pay. He would then drug them, SA them and kill them. He did bury them under his house, in some of the walls and backyard. I think his range was 15/16 yrs old to about 22; with the slightly older teens being a large amount of his victims. He also tried to go after runaways and un-housed boys.   I think about 12 out of his 20 victims have not been identified; not 100% on those numbers.   But he did not go after young children.
